section.text: Hey. Good morning. Thanks for taking my questions here.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Campanella", "section_number": 1, "uuid": "76b05e0f-1de5-4a72-860b-19f2082d5e45", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "aada2d1e-4ccc-4de9-a448-ac86f12fe809", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hi, Nick.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 3, "uuid": "504a2502-74b5-479e-abc9-6512017403ea", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Good morning. Just wanted to ask on the IRP. I know it's pending and coming soon, but you can potentially see a meaningful kind of capex opportunity out of this. And how should we think about funding any kind of incremental capex to the base five-year plan today, especially when we kind of think about common equity funding? Any thoughts there?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Campanella", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "f136e830-1dc9-4d72-9612-5fe70f920799", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Dave, do you want to take that?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "ba103ee1-de43-4d90-8159-cc06b78485ef", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Sure. We are -- as you mentioned, Nick, we're going to give more guidance on our capital plans at EEI. But you're right, we have a good opportunity with the IRP and the IRA to invest some additional capital. We do have a strong balance sheet, and rating agencies are comfortable with where we're at in our position. So we have a little flexibility there with our capital structure that we can support these investments before we have to use additional equity too.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 6, "uuid": "0caebbaa-3030-4eda-9166-4a039960d20f", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: So we'll give more detail at EEI. But I think you're right, we do see some additional capital opportunity due to the IRP and what the IRA allowed us to do.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 6, "uuid": "0caebbaa-3030-4eda-9166-4a039960d20f", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. Thanks. And then I guess as it just relates to the electric rate order -- or not order, but you got an ALJ Rec. I think you filed some exceptions as well. Just when do you see that kind of coming to fruition? And do you still kind of feel comfortable in kind of giving this outlook if -- my understanding is that proceeding comes after when you'd give the outlook? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Campanella", "section_number": 7, "uuid": "0159b7a1-ec01-41dc-8cef-43e56bf1775f", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Yes. We feel comfortable with where we're headed in multi-ALJ positions and staff positions. If you think various components of that are quite supportive of our plan. So we view it as supportive of our long-term plan. And certainly, there's a strong alignment to make the investments in the grid as well as clean generation. So there's strong alignment there as well.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 8, "uuid": "8b910fdb-ce32-4945-bf0c-f0f16df21b33", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: All right. See you at EEI. Thanks so much.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Nick Campanella", "section_number": 9, "uuid": "15e67165-6492-4a7a-be16-550d09773b8b", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "c456d5d6-578d-4783-84fa-e5c4c00fd60c", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "426acffb-aac6-4cfd-8cff-2cc8d0120bf1", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hey, guys. Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Shar Pourreza", "section_number": 13, "uuid": "8bd19c3e-0637-4667-b35a-5b8d2a037310", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Guggenheim Partners"}

section.text: Hey, Shar.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 14, "uuid": "c9cdb326-8dd8-417a-8ed6-3acd3e794fad", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Good morning, Shar.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 15, "uuid": "8d9bdd97-33ca-457e-8f46-3798586d639e", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: To Jerry, just starting off with the IRA and how that has impacted your thoughts, I guess, around the IRP, I mean, obviously, there's clearly customer benefits and lower cost. But does that trigger kind of any sort of a revision to your planning inputs versus prior to the enactment, right? Because we've been talking about this IRP for some time. So we've got a bit of a sense there. Did the IRA change, I guess, the calculus and what we've discussed before in prior slides?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Shar Pourreza", "section_number": 16, "uuid": "eeea72cf-66e0-4976-b16f-80e93ee3449c", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Guggenheim Partners"}

section.text: And then just remind us, do you have any sort of tax equity embedded in renewable spending where we could see an opportunity to avoid that tax equity and increase rate base? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Shar Pourreza", "section_number": 16, "uuid": "eeea72cf-66e0-4976-b16f-80e93ee3449c", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Guggenheim Partners"}

section.text: Great question. So the IRA had a very positive impact on IRP from two perspectives. One, certainly lowered the cost of all of our investments in renewables, as well as long term, it improved the outlook for carbon capture and storage in our IRP. So very positive benefit to affordability, which allowed us to accelerate our transition. And so I think you'll see that when we roll that out next week. So very positive impact from the IRA.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 17, "uuid": "c1e12d2a-9ef2-4b1c-aba8-dee0e82fb6ff", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: And of course, you know what the tax credits are, $26 per megawatt hour on solar and wind and PTCs on nuclear. All of those are going to have a beneficial impact to our plan. In terms of tax equity, with the IRA and the provisions in that IRA, making tax credits transferable, we no longer need tax equity structure, which significantly simplifies our plan, but also removes an investment partner. So we have now the opportunity to invest greater amounts in our renewables buildout. So very positive impact overall.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 17, "uuid": "c1e12d2a-9ef2-4b1c-aba8-dee0e82fb6ff", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. Perfect. And then just it sounds like -- I mean you guys are even more constructive on the Vantage segment post IRA. But simultaneously, there's obviously been some really high premiums paid for RNG assets. Did IRA kind of change your thoughts or even internal debates on whether you would ever put Vantage under a strategic review? And conversely, since IRA potentially accelerates Vantage's growth, does it even make sense in terms of the business mix for DTE you guys target as we're thinking about regulated utility exposure?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Shar Pourreza", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "f3c23454-ae06-4dff-97c1-6ad0dfd8cfe6", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Guggenheim Partners"}

section.text: So the way we're looking at Vantage right now, Shar, is that it will be -- our non-utility business will be 10% of our portfolio. But the IRA, the investment tax credit for RNG of 30% just made the projects we were looking at even more economic, significantly lifted the IRRs of many of the projects that we are looking at. And then the cogen investment tax credit of 30%, that also helps projects that we've got in the pipeline become much more economic. So we're excited about that. So that 10% that we're looking to create and continue to create at Vantage has just become much more economic.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "77e5e281-d055-4b0b-b71e-09ef03c9b781", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: The last one is carbon capture and storage, which we've started to explore and have some interesting small opportunities in that arena as well, which not only will be beneficial to Vantage, but it will also be beneficial to our electric utility as we think about carbon capture and storage as it relates to our generation assets. So we're really starting to understand that business in a deeper way.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "77e5e281-d055-4b0b-b71e-09ef03c9b781", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: So overall, I would say the impact on Vantage from the IRA, again, was quite positive. This IRA has had significant impact in our thinking as it relates to our electric utility as well as Vantage in terms of creating more opportunity in both business segments.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "77e5e281-d055-4b0b-b71e-09ef03c9b781", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. Terrific. Thanks, guys. And Jerry, congrats, on a side comment, on the latest addition to your family. See you guys soon at EEI.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Shar Pourreza", "section_number": 20, "uuid": "b148824d-a31a-428b-870f-7f26e98c2e9f", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Guggenheim Partners"}

section.text: Thank you. Thank you, Shar.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 21, "uuid": "aa377f6b-cbdb-4431-9a94-59ead88a0e16", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hi. Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeremy Tonet", "section_number": 23, "uuid": "84a0a1bf-7cce-428a-b1cf-f92ed94c4bc7", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: Good morning, Jeremy.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "a1625953-17e2-4ff0-9089-a5a5cc620dc0", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hi, Jeremy.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "827f8778-dd45-4310-8eaa-36f8e68eb70a", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Just wanted to start off on the RNG landscape, if I could, given the Archaea sale here and what looks on the surface to be quite a robust valuation paid there. Just wondering, any thoughts from your side on that transaction and whether that impacts your go-forward RNG strategy?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeremy Tonet", "section_number": 26, "uuid": "66754d95-2550-47e3-aed3-d1ddead1c0be", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: Yeah. Hi, Jeremy. This is Dave. It's -- as we said, we're always looking at our portfolio, considering options. We did see the Archaea sale, and I think it really highlights the value that others see for RNG and really the growth potential for RNG. And so first, it gives us confidence that we're going to find more high-growth potential projects, but also will make us continue to look to make sure that we're doing what's best for the long-term value of our shareholders.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "c8f866ea-7b3c-4ddb-b2f2-a1325e6b9f3e", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Right now, we're just really confident in our business development pipeline. We continue to grow that and continue to find really accretive projects for us.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "c8f866ea-7b3c-4ddb-b2f2-a1325e6b9f3e", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. So even with this level, I guess, of interest in the space and strong valuations, you still see new projects clearing your hurdle rate. There's not too much competition out there to drive down expected rates of return on these projects?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeremy Tonet", "section_number": 28, "uuid": "b4eff839-4742-44e1-b8fd-e441d8e4ca05", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: We have some really good projects that are in our pipeline right now. Some of these are conversions and some -- and with the IRA, some of them become even more attractive. So we still have a really strong business development pipeline that we see in the Vantage business.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 29, "uuid": "16acfca7-a20a-41b4-ad24-303cfad0b183", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeremy Tonet", "section_number": 30, "uuid": "54e2dc43-6cdd-4640-b461-edad80fec11a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: Our business development pipeline, as we look out a few years, is well stocked with high-return projects in the RNG space. And we've also got a few industrial projects, cogen projects that we're pursuing that will bring value -- long-term value to the Vantage business unit. So it feels like the pipeline to us is very strong in terms of growth with high-quality investments.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "40b6d4ee-976a-4cee-afe0-6e6a8434dcea", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. That's helpful. I'll leave it there. Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeremy Tonet", "section_number": 32, "uuid": "6107c513-f258-4cb5-93df-92f7168fac2a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: Good morning. Thanks so much for taking my question.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Arcaro", "section_number": 34, "uuid": "3bbe7a2d-2ff9-493b-ab3f-993819db4418", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "38717b5f-faad-4660-b173-da08b1bf1a6a", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: I was wondering if you could give a perspective on the Commission's audit that they recently kicked off related to outages and safety. I'm wondering what you think should come out of this in terms of potential policies or penalties or anything like that?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Arcaro", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "50dc463d-b068-4969-b704-0cb51d677041", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Sure. So as we look at the Commission order, our discussions with the Commission continue to be really collaborative. And I would say the relationship is in a good place. Ultimately, I think the result of this order is that it will create even stronger alignment as it relates to our investment agenda.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 37, "uuid": "6d84bdc7-4175-462a-8e99-66d9068ea830", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Just to give you a feel for it, our system, on average, operates at about 99.9% availability. Best-in-class is 99.97% availability of the grid. So you can see that this is a highly reliable industry when it comes to providing power to our customers. And all of our investment plans are really pointed at how do we get to that 99.97% availability for our grid. So I feel that this process with the Commission will create stronger alignment. And there's a lot of value for our customers to go even from 99.9% to 99.97%, and we'll start to lay all that out, and it will be -- I believe it will be a good process, and it will come to a good conclusion.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 37, "uuid": "6d84bdc7-4175-462a-8e99-66d9068ea830", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. Thanks. And does that sound like more operational changes or CapEx investments? Or how could that improvement play out?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Arcaro", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "e47d79c1-1544-49f2-86ef-7d78e34fd966", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Well, when I look at our circuitry, we've got systems that need to be replaced and modernized and automated. And as we rebuilt new circuits and upgrade those circuits and modernize them, it's going to require a significant amount of capital investment. And I think you'll see that in our planning as we roll out our new plan at EEI. We continue to accelerate this strategic capital that we're investing in a grid in addition to our maintenance capital. But it will be primarily a capital-driven process.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 39, "uuid": "9701219e-4252-4acb-aeb1-c1b0e8413469", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. That makes sense. And I was just wondering if you could comment on results so far for the year. And whether you've been able to -- or just what level of kind of expense you might have been able to pull into 2022 so far? What are you thinking for the rest of the year here, just as you set up into 2023 earnings guidance? Can you pull forward more expenses into 2022 given the strong results?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Arcaro", "section_number": 40, "uuid": "afbb1229-60fe-427d-8cb5-c6909ad12725", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Yes. We have had a strong year in 2022. And as we -- as we look at our portfolio over the few years, we do try to balance what we can do in '22 and '23 across all our businesses. So we have been able to find some opportunity to help 2023 as we go through this year, too, because as you've seen, '22 has been a nice strong year for us.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 41, "uuid": "45a42df2-44bf-4373-9cfd-170b7d2ab02f", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay. Thanks. Appreciate the color.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Arcaro", "section_number": 42, "uuid": "3cf51d79-3826-4678-8056-08a4589f6d88", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Yeah. Thanks. I think just one for me remaining, just as we think about I guess the update that you guys will give at EEI especially the long-term growth rate, a lot of positives here that you mentioned, what are some of the I guess offsetting factors that we should consider. And on a net basis, do you still see overall developments as a positive? I guess on the netting out basis, I would think of whether it's cost inflation or maybe a holding company leverage, refinancing, those type of items? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Insoo Kim", "section_number": 44, "uuid": "b85e417a-c868-43e5-b833-115c2f3947ae", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Goldman Sachs"}

section.text: I'll start, and I'll turn it over to Dave, Insoo. But overall, net positive. We view our ability to invest on behalf of our customers to really transform our generation fleet to a cleaner, more reliable fleet as a significant opportunity, and that will be the basis of our IRP. And also, the investment in the grid to drive increased resiliency and reliability of the grid will be a significant opportunity for us.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 45, "uuid": "4c2f7669-ab71-4d67-93f5-e95882b7f1d8", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: So this is going to create a transformative opportunity in how we deliver power and produce power for our customers, but also create a very significant investment opportunity for our investors to invest against all of this. And many of our investments are pointed at areas that will reduce operating costs as well. So for example, our generation transformation will be a net positive to our customers. Investing in our grid ultimately would be a net positive to our customers. So we're pretty excited. And this historic [Indecipherable] transformation that we're undertaking at DTE for our electric company.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 45, "uuid": "4c2f7669-ab71-4d67-93f5-e95882b7f1d8", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. Maybe I'll look for one more. As we think about the updated growth plan coming out of EEI, what is the base I guess, year or EPS that we should be contemplating when you give your roll forward? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Insoo Kim", "section_number": 46, "uuid": "e97d9185-c372-4302-8acb-e6ac83ebe2bf", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Goldman Sachs"}

section.text: Yes, we do our roll forward, we always go back to original guidance. So this will be on 2022 original guidance.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 47, "uuid": "7a55c33d-a92e-4a87-b76c-d77df7f9ae59", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Got it. Thank you so much.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Insoo Kim", "section_number": 48, "uuid": "b550f191-26d2-4c0a-b8e4-8543fbde5e51", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Goldman Sachs"}

section.text: Okay. Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 49, "uuid": "260c6ae8-9fb2-4069-9a22-10fc9c49751f", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hi. Good morning, and thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Paul Zimbardo", "section_number": 51, "uuid": "3c3c1805-23d8-42af-8a85-08dada94279e", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 52, "uuid": "89c4d6d6-1857-4eda-a774-0973d05fbeca", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Just wanted to follow up on a comment you made about interest rates. You said if I heard it right, you contemplated higher rates in the plan, so no impact on long-term growth. Just to clarify, is it that you assume kind of rates up here? Or is it that you have other offsets, whether costs are elsewhere and the plan to dampen that impact and fully offset?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Paul Zimbardo", "section_number": 53, "uuid": "7792c3f8-f03e-430e-89cc-11bd103dc99a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: We have a tendency to plan conservatively, and we look at a lot of risk and opportunities in our plan. We look at that every week and look at the challenges. So we are confident that depending or irregardless of how rates move -- regardless how rates move, we will be able to offset those with other things within our plan.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 54, "uuid": "138fb8a6-686a-4646-ab7d-dda734b68ad3", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay. Great. And then broadly, could you discuss kind of how demand has been on voluntary renewables throughout 2022? I know it's been a very eventful year. You had a large automaker announcement on solar this summer. And if you could discuss kind of incremental partnerships using that model from Ford that you're contemplating?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Paul Zimbardo", "section_number": 55, "uuid": "5ef2f389-aa8a-4ad0-a54a-04d2e75ebf62", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: Well, it's been an extraordinary year for our voluntary renewables program. Actually, as a matter of fact, this week, we executed -- or in the process of executing an agreement for another 400 megawatts of sales long-term commitments. This takes us now to a total of 2,100 megawatts sold, which is well above our expectations at where we would be at this point in time. So we'll provide an update at EEI as to how do we see this progress and the success impacting our long-term plan. So we'll update you on that. But it's been an extraordinary success story.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 56, "uuid": "dfd7099d-0a3c-4068-8b83-ceb0e68aaf1a", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay. Great. And to follow up on that super quickly. Do you think you can replicate the kind of success you've had in 2022 and 2023?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Paul Zimbardo", "section_number": 57, "uuid": "8ced1337-83cb-45e1-8b46-ce2bef05752b", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: Well, we've got significant opportunities in front of us. The pipeline is strong, and we'll continue to grow that program. And then as we look at transformation of our generation fleet, that will also bring new opportunity to the renewables fleet. So renewables will be a big part of our agenda going forward here at DTE.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 58, "uuid": "162f2acb-1c74-4338-bcf5-d865ddb92abe", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay, great. Thank you very much.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Paul Zimbardo", "section_number": 59, "uuid": "722b1939-2db8-403d-985c-ddeb7a7a753b", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America"}

section.text: Hey, there. Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Sullivan", "section_number": 61, "uuid": "b9aa6db9-90eb-4814-8b21-bb57eccd3974", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Wolfe Research"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 62, "uuid": "2357c467-a49d-484a-851b-7122b25ba175", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hey, Jerry. Dave, this one is actually for you. Just following on the AMT impact. Can you just let us know what you're assuming for the repairs tax deduction on your kind of end result there?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Sullivan", "section_number": 63, "uuid": "22549798-f132-4250-8259-82e95af6a7d5", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Wolfe Research"}

section.text: Yeah. Thanks, Michael. Yeah, right now, we're looking at it as written. So we think that the way it's written, it does apply to things like storm repairs and doesn't get the favorable treatment under the AMT [Phonetic]. Even with that, we don't see that this is going to have a big income or cash impact on our plan. We do know that EEI is advocating to have this included and we would benefit from that also. But we've already modeled that we can mitigate any cash or income impact from the AMT for the most part.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 64, "uuid": "011692dc-a36a-4f1b-bd3a-1a2747ac3e20", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay. That's super helpful. And then just sticking with that, I think you mentioned some cushion versus credit metrics. Can you just refresh us on where you're at on FFO to debt and what the thresholds are?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Sullivan", "section_number": 65, "uuid": "edfb6c0c-6c90-4d64-bff0-ba492dac8347", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Wolfe Research"}

section.text: Yeah. For -- it's a little different across the agencies. But right now, we're around 16% FFO to debt. You can see the thresholds by rating agencies are in the 13% to 14% range. So we do have some cushion there to those levels.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 66, "uuid": "ac4e7fea-7607-4508-975f-fb8f384e1fe7", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Great. Thanks a lot.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Sullivan", "section_number": 67, "uuid": "daa471ce-13f7-46eb-9ffe-796a3044080a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Wolfe Research"}

section.text: Good morning. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Travis Miller", "section_number": 69, "uuid": "ee14ae60-8886-4902-88f7-8cf098127501", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morningstar"}

section.text: Good morning, Travis.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 70, "uuid": "5dbc0572-d052-4e25-aa0b-12818acff31b", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 71, "uuid": "11037c84-5b69-425a-9ac6-9dc7c9c0d51e", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hi. With respect to the IRA, was enough detail out on that such that the full IRA impact would be included in the IRP? Or is there essentially more to come? I know you'd be able to incorporate into your own forecast, but it's 100% of it incorporated in the IRP?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Travis Miller", "section_number": 72, "uuid": "1cb350de-0c0f-4169-9707-266399ec300a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morningstar"}

section.text: It is, it is incorporated. Dave, do you want to add any thoughts to that?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 73, "uuid": "4548c032-8128-4183-bea5-096f49af40fa", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: We'll see the details as they get specified over the next year. But understanding what's going to happen in the -- at the high level for our generation, it can all be incorporated in the IRP and then how the -- how it goes into our plan, we can -- we feel like we can model that. But how it plays out specifically is still yet to be decided as you know.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 74, "uuid": "90eb4704-02d0-432b-92a2-74d5c0b0aaaf", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay. Great. Thanks. And then just real quick, any election issues in Michigan that would have a material impact either short-term or long-term outlook?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Travis Miller", "section_number": 75, "uuid": "8fb95735-bf4a-4574-8f23-554cf05b37ac", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morningstar"}

section.text: Well, certainly, we've worked well with various administrations over our history. Republican-dominated administrations, Democrat-dominated administrations. We'll see what happens in November, but it feels like the compact that exists today will likely remain intact in terms of the political structure. But we'll know more after election day. But whatever the results, we feel that we have productive relationships and that there's clear understanding by Republicans and Democrats what our investment agenda is and what the purpose of our agenda is and strong support for that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 76, "uuid": "43376429-f678-4601-9e1f-b0f4b91a8190", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay, great. Appreciate it.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Travis Miller", "section_number": 77, "uuid": "20347aff-ab0b-4b48-9d10-d8e640bd6621", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morningstar"}

section.text: Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 78, "uuid": "e8494ef7-a260-4bdb-97cd-a1324be2960b", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Jerry, Dave, good morning. Congrats on a good quarter.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Anthony Crowdell", "section_number": 80, "uuid": "459ee425-4d88-4052-a71a-ee1006cdbb32", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Mizuho"}

section.text: Good morning, Anthony.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 81, "uuid": "a927010e-70ee-4493-9a26-c7c032af6cfd", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Hey, Anthony.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 82, "uuid": "b7dda706-cca6-42a0-b188-f6e2f95d998e", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: I just have 1 quick one, and I appreciate if you want to hold an answer until you make the filing to the IRP. But just if I understand correctly, there's a lot of consensus building prior to the actual filing. Just looking for some inside debt. Is that still accurate in any particular topic or issue that you've got some more feedback than others?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Anthony Crowdell", "section_number": 83, "uuid": "b660969a-b3ce-457d-ab3c-dcccf7d20f1e", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Mizuho"}

section.text: Well, I would say, Anthony, we did an extensive amount of stakeholder engagement throughout this process, more than I believe we've ever done. And so that's been quite valuable to us. And -- but I would say, most revealing for us was when we tested our customer opinions across broad demographics what we saw was strong alignment with our IRP. And that I'll certainly be very evident when we file the IRP, engagement with other stakeholders, regulators and legislators, I would say support. Of course, as we get into the details, we'll have to work out those details, and I'm sure that some stakeholders will have different opinions, but I'm pretty confident we're going to work through all of that and end up with a really strong IRP that supports a transformation -- fundamental transformation of our generation fleet.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 84, "uuid": "ef3a3fe1-6f78-4e5e-b6af-f90d41856bb2", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Great. That's all I had. Looking forward to seeing you guys down in Hollywood.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Anthony Crowdell", "section_number": 85, "uuid": "3e6090f5-99a0-4bbc-8398-67525011967c", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Mizuho"}

section.text: Thank you, Anthony. See you soon.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 86, "uuid": "7a8290fd-fed7-4c6a-a55e-dff91320dda7", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Ryan Levine", "section_number": 88, "uuid": "5d341ee5-3885-4a4e-9bc6-a9ebeb8b4a6b", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: Hey, Ryan.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David Ruud", "section_number": 89, "uuid": "fef35def-aaee-493d-b33d-b06aad32789b", "speaker_title": "Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Good morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 90, "uuid": "4d952285-871e-45e8-a48b-a53dff552a6d", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Good morning. Given the tax incentives for RNG in your comments are on higher IRRs, what are the constraints to accelerate these growth projects in your portfolio and for your outlook?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Ryan Levine", "section_number": 91, "uuid": "a9de056a-91d0-4c0a-b9ca-aa53e98f3b47", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: I would say the constraint is keeping that portfolio at 10% of our overall enterprise in terms of earnings and EPS. But I -- what I do see with high IRRs is greater contributions to sort of more efficient capital deployment, if you will, as we see higher IRRs, so very juicy projects. That means we'll invest less capital and get the same EPS.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 92, "uuid": "bee11cc3-e19a-43d4-937a-741374e4c2ff", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Okay. And then given the large changes to LCFS prices, are you looking to evolve your hedging strategy with these projects?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Ryan Levine", "section_number": 93, "uuid": "85b732a9-0c62-4e7f-be2b-7d35b32b28d9", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: We've had a pretty strong hedging program with LCFS and also how we place some of our federal products. And we've got a combination of what I would call financial hedges against these sales as well as fixed long-term sales -- price sales, price that are priced. That's helping to balance any sort of fluctuations that we may get, as well as we build contingency into that plan to accommodate any positions that might remain open.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 94, "uuid": "b4085ca0-eadb-468f-966a-46f4f002e88b", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: So given your constraint or your stated constraint around 10% of your portfolio contribution to these assets, do you view DTE as a long-term holder of this portfolio? As that suggests that the growth prospects may be higher for somebody else.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Ryan Levine", "section_number": 95, "uuid": "cd468976-4198-4291-a5d0-bf8bb6fa686a", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: Well, look at, if we saw an opportunity to harvest and get more value than we see, we're always open to that. And I think we've got a long track record of doing that in non-utility businesses. We've reinvented ourselves in this space, 3 and 4 times since I've been at DTE. And we've always been very successful in building these businesses. And if the time presents itself and the opportunity presents itself to harvest and create incremental value for our investors, we're up for that. And we're looking at that all the time.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 96, "uuid": "87e1aa25-b88e-40d0-87c8-a9d300b68b8f", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Appreciate the color. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Ryan Levine", "section_number": 97, "uuid": "d237203f-04f1-456e-97e2-961ebab5732f", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 98, "uuid": "060d564a-9944-4d2e-80bb-214eda5b6afd", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

section.text: Well, thank you, everyone, for joining us today. I'll close by saying that DTE has had a very successful third quarter, and we're feeling great about the remainder of the year as well as our position for future years. I'll look forward to seeing many of you at EEI in a couple of weeks. Have a great morning, be healthy and stay safe.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jerry Norcia", "section_number": 100, "uuid": "7debb641-8e1a-40a7-abc5-0d062315eae3", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at DTE Energy"}

title: Q&A for DTE (DTE Energy) on 10/27/22 8:30 AM ET
